intro: Graphorkis ovalis, commonly known as the oval spiderwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its linear, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, bright blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. It is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in full sun. The flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by insects such as bees and flies.
